metadata.title: CVE-2012-3467 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache QPID 0.14, 0.16, and earlier uses a NullAuthenticator mechanism toauthenticate catch-up shadow connections to AMQP brokers, which allowsremote attackers to bypass authentication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3467` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libqmf1 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqmf2-1 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqmfconsole2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqmfengine1 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpid-perl - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpid-ruby1.8 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpidbroker2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpidclient2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpidcommon2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpidmessaging2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libqpidtypes1 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
librdmawrap2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
libsslcommon2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
python-cqmf2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
python-cqpid - 0.16-7ubuntu1
python-qmf - 0.16-7ubuntu1
python-qmf2 - 0.16-7ubuntu1
qmfgen - 0.16-7ubuntu1
qpid-client - 0.16-7ubuntu1
qpidd - 0.16-7ubuntu1
ruby-qpid - 0.16-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qpid-cpp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.16-7ubuntu1').
